description:
**Heating Technologies and their Potential**

Energy potentials from **solar thermal energy**, **air-source heat pumps**, **aquathermal energy, ground-source heat pumps** (open and closed systems), and **excess heat** (direct utilization and utilization via heat pumps) in Austria for the current status (2023), future projections (2030 & 2040), and the technical potential at LAU 2 level.

The map contains information on **annual heat supplied to heating systems**, in GWh per year (**Energy)**

**Technical potential** represents the maximum energy flow under physical and technical constraints, such as efficiency and spatial limitations. **Realisable potential for 2030 and 2040** considers practical barriers like implementation timing, market conditions, and economic feasibility.

Realizable potential for 2030 and 2040 are provided with defined ranges: ***Low*** (conservative and less ambitious), ***Medium*** (realistic with a high likelihood of occurrence) and ***High*** (optimistic and ambitious).

The map includes **potentials without considering climate change effects** (WOCC).

[download raw absolut compare data](https://workspace-ui-public.gtif-austria.hub-otc.eox.at/api/public/share/public-4wazei3y-02/KLIEN-studie/ambient/comparison/comparison_generated_heat_absolut_EEPOT_W23.geojson)

title: Comparison of Generated Heat - Share
